Literature Review: The COVID-19 pandemic has had a profound impact on carceral systems, particularly in the United States, where prisons and jails have become hotspots for the virus. This literature review synthesizes the available data on the impact of COVID-19 on incarcerated individuals, correctional officers, health systems, and surrounding communities. The review draws on 77 studies published between March 2020 and February 2022, focusing on the epidemiology of the disease, prevention and mitigation efforts, and health outcomes.
